data.question: When is Full/Span calibration required? Select all that apply.
choices: 30 days or more since last calibration

question: What is the difference between calibration and a bump test?
choices: A bump test determines whether the MultiRAE can detect if a possibly hazardous gas is present, and calibration checks that equipment is accurate.
Calibration determines whether the MultiRAE can detect if a possibly hazardous gas is present, and a bump test checks that equipment is accurate.
data.answer: A bump test determines whether the MultiRAE can detect if a possibly hazardous gas is present, and calibration checks that equipment is accurate.

data.question: Which of these is an accurate reason for the Fast Start Up?
choices: Reduces the amount of time between when the instrument is turned on and is ready for use
It skips showing you many settings
Is best suited to environments where the MultiRAE is turned on and off very often during a given day
When the details of all the sensors are not needed
